turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Where are my children?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: They're still in the house.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: He's going to kill you.  Don't you know that?  He can't take the chance that you'll talk.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Did you find the disks?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Then you have everything.  You can put them away.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: A man has my family.  Gold watch here. Dark tan.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: That would be Glen Howell.  He was on his way for the disks.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: How do I reach him?

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN
turns.text: Where's your gun?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I'm the Chief.  I don't carry it.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN
turns.text: Follow the Mustang.  We won't go far.

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN
turns.text: Don't just fuckin' sit there, dumbass. Do you understand?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN
turns.text: These guys are going to take hold of you. Don't freak out.  It's for your own good.

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN
turns.text: Can we let go?  You past your shock and all that, we can turn you loose and you won't do something stupid?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: You can let go.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Marlon and Al....

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN
turns.text: We want them.  You will not let anyone go into that house--or anything come out-- until my people recover these disks.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I can't control what happens.  The Sheriffs are running the scene.

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN
turns.text: You will re-assume command.  In two hours, a group of my people will arrive at York Estates.  You will tell the Sheriffs that they are an FBI tactical team.

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN
turns.text: When this phone rings, you answer.  It will be me.  I'll tell you what to do. When I have what I want, you get your family.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: You want . . . Marlon and Al.

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN
turns.text: I have people in York Estates right under your nose.  If you do <u>anything</u> except what I'm telling you, you'll get Jane and Amanda back in the mail.  We clear on that?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: These disks . . . where are they?

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN
turns.text: Smith will know.

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: You dumb fuckwad cop, you fucked up <u>bad</u>!

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Do you think I'm going to let you <u>murder</u> someone?!

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: <u>You want a blowtorch on your daughter's</u> <u>pretty face</u>?!

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I'll go in that fuckin' house right now! I'll give those disks to the <u>real</u> FBI, you COCKSUCKINGMOTHERFUCKER!!  And I've got <u>Smith</u>!  <u>I've got Smith</u>!!

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: I guess we each have something the other wants.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: I guess we do.

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: My people are good to go.  You know who I mean?

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: Your phony FBI assholes.

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: We're almost home, you and me.  Keep your shit together.  This isn't L.A.

turns.speaker: TALLEY
turns.text: What do you mean by that?

turns.speaker: THE WATCHMAN'S VOICE
turns.text: You don't want another dead child on your conscience.

turns.speaker: BENEDICT
turns.text: Paul, Paul, a moment please.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yes, Benedict, what can I do?

turns.speaker: BENEDICT
turns.text: Can you get me into the Ambassador's reception?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm sorry, it's a private function.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What happened?

turns.speaker: BENEDICT
turns.text: They're killing everyone. The Lady Minister! The UN soldiers. They're at the gate.

turns.speaker: BENEDICT
turns.text: Paul, we would like to speak to you in your office.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We, who is we?

turns.speaker: BENEDICT
turns.text: A delegation.

turns.speaker: BIK
turns.text: Paul!

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Gregoire will deal with it, excuse me.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Gregoire, there are no cockroaches in this hotel, do you understand?

turns.speaker: BIK
turns.text: Cockroaches?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No, Bik, it's a code word for Tutsis.

turns.speaker: BIK
turns.text: That's what I came to talk to you about.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Excuse me?

turns.speaker: BIK
turns.text: The Hutu-Tutsi thing. The BBC faxed to say they would be here on the sixth for the peace accords. And the U.N. wants the banquet room for that day, a reception to broadcast the signing ceremony. Can you organize monitors and check the satellite dish?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Leave it to me.

turns.speaker: BIK
turns.text: Also, could you remember to use the service entrance at all times?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: BIK
turns.text: Paul...  ...I have to talk to you.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'll be back.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Who are you?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I am Paul Rusesabagina, a good friend of General Bizimungu.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: We are looking for you.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What is this about?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Let me see your identity card.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: You heard the Tutsi cockroaches murdered our president.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yes, it is a calamity for us all.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: You work at the Hotel Diplomat?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No. I work at the Mille Collines.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I used to work at the Diplomat.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Do you know how to open the safe there?  Our government needs to use the hotel and the room keys are in the safe. You must open it.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Captain, I must take my family. It is not safe here.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Where is your family?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: They are all Tutsi cockroaches.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Let me explain.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Please, I don't use guns.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: There is nothing to it.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: You want to pay me?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Why not? These are not rebels, look at them. Soon they will be worthless to you. Why not take some money, for your work?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Name a price.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Ten thousand francs for each one.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I don't have that much.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Here, here, a thousand US dollars - fifty thousand francs for my family. To let us drive off to the Mille Collines.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: How many in your family?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Six.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Ten.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: And four children?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'll give you a hundred thousand francs for all of them.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Give me it.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I don't have it here. At the Mille Collines. I can get it for you.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: You will run into the hotel and hide behind the U.N.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I swear, Captain, one hundred thousand francs, enough for a house. I will get the money, you keep them outside.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Don't be foolish. There's more money to be made here.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: You want to buy anymore cockroaches ask for Captain Naramunju.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Do we know who fired the missile that killed the president?

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: No. But I fear it's intention may have been to kill the peace accords and spark a civil war between the Hutu Militia and the Tutsi rebels.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: We've heard reports of reprisal killings. Will the UN intervene to stop the bloodshed.?

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: Unfortunately we're here as peace-keepers not peace makers, we can't take an aggressive role.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: If the UN changes your mandate could you stop the bloodshed?

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: Yes. With some re-inforcements I'm confident we could impose order.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Have you requested re-enforcements?

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: Yes we have.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: What was the response?

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: We're awaiting a decision, excuse me.

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: Paul, you know who this is?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yes, Colonel Monsieur Xavier, the Minister of Finance.

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: Get him a room, but tell no one he is here.  Paul will look after you.

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: Paul, I've sent my soldiers to rescue the Lady Prime Minister, she'll need a room.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yes sir, but these people  they cannot stay here. I've heard you have a refugee center at the airport Stadium?

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: I'm sorry, I can't possibly take them Paul. I'm overrun with refugees. As soon as we can stabilize the situation we'll take them.

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: Hold the line here. Do not shoot! The Colonel stabilizes the situation, his men watch the militia drive by. Paul approaches Oliver

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What's happening?

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: They murdered my soldiers. Ten Belgians who I sent to get the lady minister.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Where is she?

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: Anything. Strong.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Canadian Club?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Congratulations, Colonel. You have saved us all.

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: Congratulations. You should spit in my face.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Excuse me, Colonel.

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: We think you are dirt, less than dirt, worthless.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I don't understand.

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: Don't bullshit me, Paul. You're the smartest man here. You have them all eating out of your hand. You'd own this fucking hotel, except for one thing.

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: You're fucking black! You're not even a nigger, you're African!  They're not staying to stop this thing. They're gonna fly right out of here with their people.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Their people?

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: They're only taking the whites.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: They fired a rocket at us.

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: Yes. Where are the Rwandan police?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I ran out of bribes. Bizimungu took them away.

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: That explains it. I'm sorry to tell you this but we've heard rumors the Militia are getting ready to storm the hotel.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Will you protect us.

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: I can't, I don't have the men.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: The rebels have fought their way into the city. They have many Hutu prisoners.

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: Paul, I need you to buy me a day or two. I don't have the fuel for this convoy. I will have to scrounge it.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I can't. I have nothing left to bribe with. Can your men at the gate hold out for another day?

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: No, Paul, they're afraid. They've demanded to be moved back to headquarters now.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Give me their uniforms. I will put people at the gate, in disguise.

turns.speaker: COLONEL OLIVER
turns.text: I wish I could, Paul. Try to hold out.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: Paul, this scotch is exceptional.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: It's a single malt, Glenmorangie. I thought you'd like it. Anything you need, gentlemen, let me know.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: Oh, Paul, talk to the coat check, please.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm sorry it is not Glenmorangie.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: As long as it is scotch.  Your white friends have abandoned you, Paul.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The United Nations are still here.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: The United Nations. Madmen are on the streets, Paul. But I will take care of you.  Your cellar is well-stocked, right?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yes, General. I am glad you came by. I overheard something that I think you should know about.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: What did you overhear?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: A discussion between an American Embassy official and a UN Colonel.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: What did they say?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The American assured the colonel that they would watch everything.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: Watch everything? How? They are gone.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Satellites.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: Satellites?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yes, they can photograph the epaulets on your shoulder.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: And what will they do with these satellites?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The American said intervention is too costly, better to get photographic evidence and snatch up the high command.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: The high command? Our high command?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: 'Snatch them up and put on a war crimes trial. Lock them all away forever. No political risk, and big publicity.' That's what he said.  I thought I'd better tell you.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: The Americans! Who are they to put us on trial. Let us imagine Paul when their president Kennedy was shot, they said it was a black man. Then their politicians, their radio stations gave orders we must wipe out these black people before they wipe out us. What do you think would have happened? No different.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Indeed, general. Excuse me momentarily.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I am worried about thieves and criminals coming into the hotel. Perhaps you could arrange for some police to guard us.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: The police are very busy.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I understand General, but when I last talked to the president of Sabena he promised me that anyone who helped protect Belgian property would be rewarded.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: He did.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Well rewarded Those were his words.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: If I were to spare a few policemen, where would I station them?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The front gate would be best, General.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: I will see what I can do.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I admire you, General. How do you keep command of your men amidst such madness?

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: I am strong, Paul, like a lion.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I wish I were like you. Look at my staff, they won't work, they listen to no one.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Please, General, I will give you money, whiskey.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: You said you had no whiskey.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Please, I have money. They're driving into an ambush, it's on the radio.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: Where are my supplies?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm sorry, General. The cellar is empty.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: You have cockroaches dancing on tables and you tell me the cellar is empty? Did they drink my whiskey?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No. We have no way of finding other stock but I have money for you from the guests.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: General, sir. I am glad to find you. I have found you some supplies.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: Whiskey?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The finest, and cognac, champagne. Come and I will get them for you.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: I'll be over.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Bring back your policemen...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We must go to the Diplomat.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: Get in.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Your police are at the gate?

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: After the Diplomat! Paul clambers in the back.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Where are they going?

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: They can go where they want. They are in charge now.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What do you mean, General?

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: We have decided to move the government to Gitarama.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: When?

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: Today.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: You know what the Scottish call it?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: Ishca Baha - the water of life. I went on a tour once of the finest single malt distillery in the world. Have you ever been to Scotland?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: No, sir.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: Wonderful country, wonderful golf. I wonder - will I ever go back? What do you think?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I hope we all get to do many things. Can we go now?

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: Pack those carefully, put them in my jeep, and guard them.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Please, General, call and put your policemen back at the gate.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: I am going to do you a great favor.  I am going to take you with us to Gitarama.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I do not want to go to Gitarama, General.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: You cannot go back to the hotel. The crazy men are going there now. Better to come with me.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: We are better here.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Listen, you need me.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You are a marked man.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: How so.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The Americans, and the UN they have you as a war criminal. You are on a list.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: I am on a list! What list?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: When the Europeans left, their soldiers gathered lists.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: You lie.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: If you do not help me, you will stay on that list.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: I committed no war crimes.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Who will tell them? You need me to tell how you helped the hotel. The others who have gone, they blame you for all their misfortune. They say you led the massacres.

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: I led no massacres.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You think they will believe you?

turns.speaker: GENERAL BIZIMUNGU
turns.text: You will tell them the truth.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I will do nothing unless you help me now.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I will try my best George but these days I have no time for rallies or politics.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Politics is power, Paul. And money.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Time is money, George. We need extra beer today.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Business is good at the hotel?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Very good.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: I am always glad to see you Paul.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: A bargain buy, from China. Ten cents each, I'll get a dollar.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: At least.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Everything is double the price now, you do understand that?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I need rice, beans, beer, and your best whiskey.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Beer yes, but no whiskey.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You have no whiskey?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: No whiskey, no spirits. Your rich cockroaches at the hotel, they will have to do without their scotch. Anyway, I have bled that cow enough Paul.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: What do you mean George?

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Their money is no good to them. Soon all the Ineysi will be dead.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: ) You cannot kill them all.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Why not? We are half way there already.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: GEORGE
turns.text: Take the river road back. It is clear.

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: For fuck's sake, Gloria There's a big news story out there! We need to get out and cover it.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Were not going outside the hotel grounds unless we have an armored car. That's the ground rules.

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: Ground rules! Where the fuck do you think you are, Wimbledon?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: We cover the story from here until we can get proper protection.

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: Satellite feed.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Great.  No kidding, When will they be here? Excellent. Yes, call then.

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: Holy shit! Holy shit.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: You fucking see that!

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Oh my God!

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: Here, have a sandwich.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Lets go, Jock.

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: Go! What the fuck sort of journalists are we, running from a war? I'm ashamed. Are you? Well, are ya'?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Youre drunk.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Great, I really need a shower.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Just give me a moment to get your keys.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The fifth room is your broadcast room.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Good. I'd like to book a massage.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: The news room has heard that the French and the Belgians are putting together an intervention force.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: When will they be here?

turns.speaker: GLORIA
turns.text: Very soon.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Thank God.

turns.speaker: GREGOIRE
turns.text: There are no more rooms.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Give me the phone.

turns.speaker: GREGOIRE
turns.text: Mr. Manager.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Gregoire, what are you doing here?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Get out of this room and get back to work.

turns.speaker: GREGOIRE
turns.text: I don't have to listen to you anymore.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I am in charge now. Get back to work or I'll fire you.

turns.speaker: GREGOIRE
turns.text: Let me ask you Mr. Manager, do you notice a smell of cockroaches? If I were to leave this room, I'm sure I could find this smell. I know people who could cleanse it. But maybe it doesn't bother you? Why is that? Are used to this smell? Not me, I need a clean room to escape it.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Gregoire it is good to see you back to work.

turns.speaker: GREGOIRE
turns.text: Please, except my humblest apologies...

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Don't worry. I have a job this morning. I must go to visit my good friend George Rutagunda. You know George?

turns.speaker: GREGOIRE
turns.text: Where are we going, sir?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: For supplies, you drive.

turns.speaker: GREGOIRE
turns.text: The fog is too heavy, sir.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Just drive, Gregoire.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Are you sure this is the river road?

turns.speaker: GREGOIRE
turns.text: I saw the sign.

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: Paul, how the hell are ya'?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I am delighted to see you, Mr. Daglish.

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: They moved you from the Diplomat?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Promoted. House Manager.

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: Good for you.  We're having a little trouble, Paul. We booked five rooms, but...

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: Did you bring any of those wee girls who used to sit at the bar in the Diplomat with you? You know?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Daglish, this is the Mille Collines. No working girls here.

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: Can we phone them in, Paul?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm afraid I can't do that, Mr. Daglish.

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: Perfect timing.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: This goes out live?

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: Give her what she wants, room, food, anything. Charge it all. Don't you put her out, Paul.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I would never do that.

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: I know that, Paul. I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: This is a Rolex, I can't take it.

turns.speaker: JOCK
turns.text: Take it for Christ sake. I wish it was a fucking aeroplane.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: You are the manager?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yes, sir. What is wrong?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Everyone must leave the hotel now.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Why sir?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: It's an order. Get everyone out now.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I...ah...need some time. Please give us twenty, thirty minutes. People are sleeping.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Anderson, Arthurs, Boulier. What is this?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: The guest list. It hasn't been updated since the murder of the president.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Are you trying to make a fool of me? There are no Europeans left in that hotel. Get me the names of all the cockroaches in there.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: That will take time.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: You don't have time. If I do not have the names, so that I can pick out the traitors, then I will kill everyone here in this car park. Get in there now.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Who did you call?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Call, sir?

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: Don't lie to me. What's your name?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Rusesabagina. Paul Rusesabagina.

turns.speaker: LIEUTENANT
turns.text: I will remember that name.  Let's go.

turns.speaker: MILITIAMAN #1
turns.text: What do you want?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We are to meet Mr. Rutagunda.

turns.speaker: MILITIAMAN #1
turns.text: The commander is not here.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: He will be here.

turns.speaker: MILITIAMAN #1
turns.text: Show me your ID

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: MILITIAMAN #1
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Our cards, please.

turns.speaker: MILITIAMAN #1
turns.text: What cards?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: You have our cards.

turns.speaker: MILITIAMAN #1
turns.text: No. But I make cards. Would you like me to make you two cards?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: MILITIAMAN #1
turns.text: One thousand francs.

turns.speaker: MILITIAMAN #1
turns.text: Show us the manager. He wears a suit.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: They have him in the lobby, go quickly.

turns.speaker: MR. GARINDI
turns.text: Terrible times, Paul. There are bodies everywhere. I cannot stay here.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I need a great favor.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I need you to go to this address and bring my brother-in-law and his family.

turns.speaker: MR. GARINDI
turns.text: No, no. This is a very dangerous part of town. I cannot do this.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: This would be an enormous favor to me. I am a man of means, Mr. Garandi. When this nonsense is over I will be most grateful.

turns.speaker: MR. GARINDI
turns.text: I will see what I can do.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Was there blood?

turns.speaker: MR. GARINDI
turns.text: No blood. As I left a neighbor, an old woman, waved to me. I went to her house. She has the little girls. They are safe.

turns.speaker: MR. GARINDI
turns.text: It is dangerous to be here. The radio says this is a nest of cockroaches.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I need one last favor. Go back and get the twins.

turns.speaker: MR. GARINDI
turns.text: No, it is impossible. That side of town has been destroyed in the fighting. The children are dead.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: MR. GARINDI
turns.text: Everyone is dead there. The dogs eat the bodies in the street. I have to go.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I will give you my house.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: I will need a suite.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm afraid you will have to move room.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: Move? Where to?

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: I'm going to put you on the third floor.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: The third floor are low class rooms.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Yes they are. However if the army return they will expect important people such as yourself to be in these grand rooms.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: Pack the bags, we have to move.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: Also, this is your bill for the last week.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: This time the Militia will kill us.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: They will surely kill us here. It's over here. We have to take the chance.

turns.speaker: XAVIER
turns.text: They should go one truck at a time. When the first truck gets through to the airport, then the others will follow.

turns.speaker: PAUL
turns.text: We can't wait. We all go together or not at all.
